@Electrical_field_2D/putFOV.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 % =========================================================================
00002 %> @brief putFOV returns image where given fov was put into given image
00003 %>
00004 %> @param sensor        sensor object
00005 %> @param perm_distrib  permittivity distribution object
00006 %> @param fovImgR       side size of reconstruction image
00007 %> @param method        interpolating method for image rescaling (default is bilinear).
00008 %>                      For more see imresize help.
00009 %> @param fillBorder    flag, 0-1, extrapolate borders of fov to fill whole fov
00010 %>                      in simulation resolution (0 no fill, 1 fill, default 0)
00011 %> @retval img          resize image
00012 % =========================================================================
00013 function [img] = putFOV(ef_obj,sensor, perm_distrib, fovImgR, method,fillBorder)
00014 
00015 for i=1:length(sensor.vector_sensor_elements)
00016     name=sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).element_name;
00017     if(strcmp(name,'fov'))
00018         fov_size=sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).rmax*2;
00019     end
00020 end
00021 
00022 sFOV=fov_size;                      % fov size (pix)
00023 sMtxS=sensor.discretization_grid.number_of_x_axis_pixel;   % simulation matrix size (pix)
00024 
00025 sMtxR=length(fovImgR);
00026 
00027 % we assume that fov is centered on image
00028 % and image matrix have the same size as simulation matrix
00029 simulation_phantom_matrix = perm_distrib.Discretization_grid_perm.get_matrix();
00030 [sx sy]=size(simulation_phantom_matrix);
00031 if(sx~=sMtxS || sy~=sMtxS),
00032     img = [];
00033     display('ERR: Image and simulation matrix size are different.');
00034     return;
00035 end
00036 
00037 % check if filling border is set
00038 if(nargin<5),
00039     fillBorder=0; % if not set default
00040 end;
00041 
00042 %fill (extrapolate) borders if flag set
00043 if(fillBorder),
00044     % to do
00045     % recon matrix fov mask (big pixels)
00046     rmfm=zeros(sMtxR+4);    % add 2 pix margin for further filtering image
00047     % put resized mask of big pixels fov
00048     % but first take only fov pixels
00049     m=round((sMtxS-sFOV)/2);
00050     
00051     simulation_phantom_matrix = perm_distrib.Discretization_grid_perm.get_matrix();
00052     fov=simulation_phantom_matrix(m+(1:1:sFOV),m+(1:1:sFOV));
00053 
00054     rmfm(3:sMtxR+2,3:sMtxR+2)=imresize(fov,[sMtxR,sMtxR]);
00055     % reconstructed fov with border
00056     fovR_wb_orig=zeros(sMtxR+4); 
00057     fovR_wb_orig(3:sMtxR+2,3:sMtxR+2)=fovImgR;
00058     fovR_wb_extr=fovR_wb_orig;  % image with extrapolated values (to calculate)
00059     se=strel('square',3);
00060     rmfm_border=imdilate(rmfm,se)-rmfm;
00061     % brute forse method with loop ... do it better, if You know how
00062     for i=1:(sMtxR+4)*(sMtxR+4),
00063         if(rmfm_border(i)>0),
00064             %extrapolate border values using four neighbours
00065             d=sum([rmfm(i+1) rmfm(i-1) rmfm(i+sMtxR+4) rmfm(i-(sMtxR+4))]);
00066             if d==0, 
00067                 continue;
00068             end;
00069             fovR_wb_extr(i)=sum([rmfm(i+1)*fovR_wb_orig(i+1) rmfm(i-1)*fovR_wb_orig(i-1) rmfm(i+sMtxR+4)*fovR_wb_orig(i+sMtxR+4) rmfm(i-(sMtxR+4))*fovR_wb_orig(i-(sMtxR+4))])/d;
00070         end
00071     end
00072 
00073     fovImgR=fovR_wb_extr(3:sMtxR+2,3:sMtxR+2);
00074 end
00075 
00076 
00077 % check if interpolation method is given
00078 if(nargin<4),
00079     method='bilinear'; % if not set default
00080 end;
00081 % rescale and fit reconstruction fov to simulation resolution
00082 fovImgS=zeros(sMtxS);
00083 margin=round((sMtxS-sFOV)/2);
00084 fovImgS(margin+1:margin+sFOV,margin+1:margin+sFOV)= ...
00085     imresize(fovImgR,[sFOV,sFOV],method);
00086 
00087 fovImgS(find(fovImgS==0))=1;
00088 
00089 img=fovImgS;
00090 
00091 return;
00092
